audios.au: Using the height sensors ECAS detects the current distance between the chassis and the axle.
The height sensor is mounted to the chassis and is connected to the axle via a lever and a linkage .
Changings of the level result in corresponding changes of the lever position.
When the sensor is installed it has to be ensured that its lever can freely move across the whole range of possible levels.
The length of the lever has to be chosen in such a way, that only the range of plus / minus 50 degrees around the zero position is used. The zero position is determined by the so called fixing hole.
